subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Houston Coach Gary Kubiak said that receiver Harry Williams would have surgery Sunday to repair a fractured vertebra in his neck. Williams, 26, was hurt Friday when he collided with teammate Nick Ferguson while trying to make a tackle on a kick return early in the Texans’ 23-22 loss to Dallas. Williams was taken to Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas. Kubiak said Williams’s condition had not changed since the team doctor Walter Lowe said early Saturday that Williams had regained feeling in his extremities and most of his normal neurological function.
